metadata.title: CVE-2023-6536 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NVMe driver. This issue may allow anunauthenticated malicious actor to send a set of crafted TCP packages whenusing NVMe over TCP, leading the NVMe driver to a NULL pointer dereferencein the NVMe driver, causing kernel panic and a denial of service.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-7.7').
